topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5556eb8463687264c6c41c00#post_5556eb8463687264c6c41c00

We just need to be able to channel enough energy so that it becomes physically possible to separate the concepts of space and time, have encyclopedic knowledge of the gravity effects an event horizon has on the matter and make sure the dimension we're targeting has the same energy reactions and laws as this one so as to not cause potentially devastating side effects to both ends and create a chain reaction that slowly wipes out the entire universe via dominoe effect... Alright maybe that's an exaggeration. The effect would be minor and limit to just this galaxy.

Any who. Who wants to do some science?

topics.body:
Last night, I had a very odd dream.

It started out pretty normal: I went to the doctor for an appointment to check that I wasn't growing weird hard lumps in my neck (a very real and serious problem in that dream world, it seems,) and everything went by fairly believably; she asked me about medication, squeezed my neck to make sure there were no lumps, etc... but then everything took a turn for the bizarre.

The door opened and a tall, curvy dragoness walked in ("she seemed somehow familiar":http://browniecomicwriter.deviantart.com/art/Tall-and-Short-531346898). Apparently, to make the growth of these neck lumps less likely, I was for some reason required to hold her in a very tight and intimate hug, bite her neck and drink her blood for its medicinal properties. But I tasted it and decided a) that it was far too sour, and b) that I didn't particularly want to drink anyone's blood anyway. So I took a tiny shred of tissue out of my pocket (at least, I presume that's where I got it from - at the time it kind of just appeared in my hand,) and held it to her neck - somehow stopping the bleeding.

I don't remember what happened next, but I do remember going around and telling everyone about it. Twice. Then  I woke up and realised I could still remember the texture of the dragoness' skin. (She was a bit clammy.)

Maybe my brain is trying to tell me something, but I can't for the life of me figure out what it might be.
topics.author: 52f5159b6368721440260300

topics.body:
"@BrownieComicWriter":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55571b2a636872627b401100#post_55571b2a636872627b401100
It's actually easy to understand dreams as they are all based on something you've seen, thought or experienced. You will never have a dream of something that was never known in your life.


Let's see... Lumps, dragoness, blood drinking, sour taste and for some weird and unknown reason, spreading of experience to people. 

Lumps can be based on a lot of thing actually. Maybe LSP from Adventure Time or an actual disease that exists (but more or less severe in your dream). It can even be based on a mosquito bite but enlarged in your dream.

The drinking of blood from a dragon is probably based on vampirism or dragon blood rituals where they drink or bathe dragon's blood for unique magical abilities. The dragoness came because you felt attracted to her or find her interesting.

The sour taste would be your view on medicine. Medicine is usually bitter but may sometimes be sour if you eat it with something else. When the doctor said it was medicine, the blood (labeled as medicine in your subconscious) tasted terrible to you. If he didn't say it was medicine or maybe just some erotic dream, you wouldn't taste it like that since you'd think differently.

Telling everyone about your weird day is a common thing in real life. you just had an uncommon experience so you tell people about it to make yourself look interesting or because it looks interesting, like telling someone about a good book.
